I am  new to python and I can't figure out how to turn off gravity when a cube called jimright touches a platform. But at the same time I can't make gravity turn on when he isn't on the platforms. I'm stuck, what should I do?
I tried using colliderect in def update() but it didnt work.
h1: How to make gravity work in the air but not on platforms for python3 [duplicate]
b: This question already has answers here
pre:
pygame.init()
pygame.display.init()
pygame.display.set_mode((1024, 768))
from pgzero.builtins import Actor, keyboard

HEIGHT = 800
WIDTH = 600
CENTER_X = WIDTH / 2
CENTER_Y = HEIGHT / 2
platforms = Actor("platforms")
jimright = Actor("jimright")
jimright.pos = 100, 500
game_over = False
gravity = True


def draw():
  screen.clear()
  screen.blit("backround", (0, 0))
  screen.blit("platforms", (0, 0))
  jimright.draw()


def update():
  global game_over, gravity
  if not game_over:
    if keyboard.left and jimright.x > 0:
      jimright.x -= 5
      jimright.image = "jimleft"
      gravity = True
    elif keyboard.right and jimright.x < WIDTH:
      jimright.x += 5
      jimright.image = "jimright"
      gravity = True
    elif keyboard.up and jimright.y > 150:
      jimright.y -= 5
      gravity = True
    elif keyboard.down and jimright.y < HEIGHT:
      jimright.y += 5
      gravity = True
    if gravity == True:
      jimright.y = jimright.y + 1
  
    if jimright.colliderect(platforms):
      gravity = False


import pgzrun

pgzrun.go()`

pygame.init()
pygame.display.init()
pygame.display.set_mode((1024, 768))
from pgzero.builtins import Actor, keyboard

HEIGHT = 800
WIDTH = 600
CENTER_X = WIDTH / 2
CENTER_Y = HEIGHT / 2
platforms = Actor("platforms")
jimright = Actor("jimright")
jimright.pos = 100, 500
game_over = False
gravity = True


def draw():
  screen.clear()
  screen.blit("backround", (0, 0))
  screen.blit("platforms", (0, 0))
  jimright.draw()


def update():
  global game_over, gravity
  if not game_over:
    if keyboard.left and jimright.x > 0:
      jimright.x -= 5
      jimright.image = "jimleft"
      gravity = True
    elif keyboard.right and jimright.x < WIDTH:
      jimright.x += 5
      jimright.image = "jimright"
      gravity = True
    elif keyboard.up and jimright.y > 150:
      jimright.y -= 5
      gravity = True
    elif keyboard.down and jimright.y < HEIGHT:
      jimright.y += 5
      gravity = True
    if gravity == True:
      jimright.y = jimright.y + 1
  
    if jimright.colliderect(platforms):
      gravity = False


import pgzrun

pgzrun.go()`
